case_vignette: a 60-year-old man presents with rapidly growing lesions on his face, trunk, axillae, flexural areas, and groin. the lesions appeared 3 months earlier in his perianal area and extended rapidly to other areas. previously, he was treated with topical agents for atopic dermatitis and seborrheic dermatitis without improvement. examination reveals disseminated violaceous papules and plaques on the face, trunk, axillae, and perianal area; some lesions were confluent and ulcerated. yellowish-red to skin-colored papules are present on the scalp. he has no palpable lymphadenopathy or organomegaly.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have rapidly growing spots on my face, trunk, underarms, groin, and other bendy areas that started three months ago near my rear end and spread to other parts of my body.
Do the spots itch, hurt, or have any sensation at all?
Some of the spots are painful and have ulcerated.
Have you noticed any changes in your health such as weight loss, fever, or night sweats?
No, I haven't experienced any weight loss, fever, or night sweats.
Do you have any known medical conditions or are you currently on any medications?
I was previously treated with topical agents for atopic dermatitis and seborrheic dermatitis, but they did not improve my condition.
Is there a family history of similar skin issues or other significant medical conditions?
I didn't mention any family history of similar skin issues or other significant medical conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Cutaneous T-cell lymphoma.
